description: From Middle French transversal, from Medieval Latin trānsversālis, from Latin trānsversus.

adjectives.description: transversal (comparative more transversal, superlative most transversal)

entries.meaning: Exhibiting or pertaining to transversality; connecting hetergeneous elements (fields, kinds of people, etc).

definitionGroups.group: A line which traverses or intersects any system of other lines transversely.

entries.meaning: (geometry) A line intersecting a pair of parallel lines.
(mathematics) A set containing one member from each of a collection of disjoint sets.
